required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physician's Evaluation of Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion 0.05%

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this retrospective chart review is to evaluate the patient characteristics, treatment variations and efficacy of a second trial of Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion 0.05% therapy in chronic dry eye patients who were initially treated with Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion 0.05% but discontinued use after less than 12 weeks of treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Complete Clearing of Corneal Staining at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with complete clearing of corneal staining at month 12. Corneal staining is evaluated following administration of fluorescein dye into the eye. Complete clearing is defined as the absence of corneal staining.

secondary_outcome.description: Schirmer's test at month 12. The Schirmer's tear test is performed on the eye with or without anesthesia (numbing eye drop). The amount of tears produced by the eye in 5 minutes is measured in millimeters by means of a graduated paper scale. Data not reported due to limited number of patients with Schirmer's test data recorded.

arm_group.description: Patients who received Restasis® (cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion 0.05%)

intervention.description: One drop two times a day approximately 12 hours apart

study_pop.textblock: The medical charts of all chronic dry eye patients who discontinued their first trial of RESTASIS® after less than 12 weeks of treatment and who started a second trial of RESTASIS® prior to June 1, 2008 will be included in the review.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults >16 years of age
- Dry eye patients
- Subject with history of less than 12 weeks of initial RESTASIS® treatment
- Subject started second trial of RESTASIS® treatment prior to June 1, 2008
- First day of second trial of RESTASIS® started ≥ 4 weeks after the last day of previous RESTASIS® treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Contact Lens Intolerance
- Patients with Ocular Rosacea

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Retrospective analysis. Patients may have been treated with Restasis® (cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion 0.05%) in addition to other medications during the course of the study.

group.title: Patients Who Received Restasis®
group.description: Patients who received Restasis® (cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion 0.05%)

group.title: Patients Who Received Restasis®
group.description: Patients who received Restasis® (cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion 0.05%)

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Complete Clearing of Corneal Staining at Month 12
outcome.description: Percentage of patients with complete clearing of corneal staining at month 12. Corneal staining is evaluated following administration of fluorescein dye into the eye. Complete clearing is defined as the absence of corneal staining.
outcome.population: ITT population, which consisted of all patients included in the study, with documented presence of corneal staining at baseline. For this outcome measure, a total of 18 patients had documented corneal staining at baseline.

group.title: Patients Who Received Restasis®

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Complete Clearing of Corneal Staining at Month 12
measure.description: Percentage of patients with complete clearing of corneal staining at month 12. Corneal staining is evaluated following administration of fluorescein dye into the eye. Complete clearing is defined as the absence of corneal staining.
measure.population: ITT population, which consisted of all patients included in the study, with documented presence of corneal staining at baseline. For this outcome measure, a total of 18 patients had documented corneal staining at baseline.

outcome.title: Schirmer's Test at Month 12
outcome.description: Schirmer's test at month 12. The Schirmer's tear test is performed on the eye with or without anesthesia (numbing eye drop). The amount of tears produced by the eye in 5 minutes is measured in millimeters by means of a graduated paper scale. Data not reported due to limited number of patients with Schirmer's test data recorded.
outcome.population: ITT population, which consisted of all patients included in the study with Schirmer's testing data available at baseline. Data not reported due to limited number of patients with Schirmer's test data recorded.

reported_events.desc: Serious adverse events and adverse events were not collected directly as this was a retrospective study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo
